newsData.title: Trump Signals U.S. Is Nearing Trade Deals but Says Some Countries Will Face Tariffs
newsData.summary: President Trump said the United States would send out letters telling other countries “what they have to pay,” even as other officials said negotiations could be extended past a July deadline.

newsData.title: Some Republicans Join Democrats in Unease Over White House Budget Cuts
newsData.summary: President Trump has sought to claw back funds for public broadcasting and foreign aid, sparking a fierce debate over the power of the purse.

newsData.title: Why Do Yemeni Coffeehouses Seem to Be Everywhere Lately?
newsData.summary: For cafes like Haraz Coffee House, riding a wave of interest nationwide in late-night, alcohol-free gathering spaces means embracing the franchise model.

newsData.title: White House Faces Risk of Economic Fallout From Iran Strike
newsData.summary: President Trump, aware of how high gas prices could affect his popularity, demanded on social media that the U.S. “KEEP OIL PRICES DOWN.”

newsData.title: No Rock Stars, No Mercedes: A Russian Expo Shows the Cost of Divorce With the West
newsData.summary: The annual economic forum in St. Petersburg used to yield multibillion-dollar deals and feature performances by global music stars. With the war in Ukraine still raging, the mood has shifted.

newsData.title: This Is Ground Zero in Trump’s Trade War
newsData.summary: The nation’s largest ports, in Los Angeles County, are a bellwether for the economy. They are being whipsawed as President Trump reorders global trade.

newsData.title: House Policy Bill Would Add $3.4 Trillion to Debt, Swamping Economic Gains
newsData.summary: The updated findings from the Congressional Budget Office amounted to the latest dour report card for the president’s signature legislation.

newsData.title: Companies Ask Supreme Court to Fast-Track Challenge to Tariffs
newsData.summary: Two toy manufacturers asked the court to greatly expedite their case, in an unusual request.

newsData.title: Senate Republicans Propose Key Tax Tweaks to House Bill
newsData.summary: Party lawmakers proposed changes to the tax code that could offer the greatest benefit to businesses.

newsData.title: Fed’s ‘Wait and See’ Approach Is Intact as New Risks Cloud Economic Outlook
newsData.summary: The central bank is set to hold interest rates steady for its fourth straight meeting, a pause that could be extended through the summer.

newsData.title: As Trump Returns to G7, Rift With Allies Is Even Deeper
newsData.summary: In 2018, the president called for the group to embrace Russia and stormed out of the summit. Now he is seeking to shrink America’s military role abroad and embarking on a more expansive trade war.

newsData.title: ‘Golden Share’ in U.S. Steel Gives Trump Extraordinary Control
newsData.summary: Administration officials secured a deal that will give the president unusual influence over a private company, and could serve as a model for other deals.

newsData.title: Where’s the Inflation From Tariffs? Just Wait, Economists Say.
newsData.summary: Are predictions for a jump in consumer prices too early, or just wrong?

newsData.title: Trump Steel Tariffs Expanded to Hit Home Appliances
newsData.summary: The move is one of the first times this year that consumer products were specifically targeted with higher import taxes.

newsData.title: New China Trade ‘Deal’ Takes U.S. Back to Where It Started
newsData.summary: If a handshake agreement holds, it will merely undo some of the damage from the trade war that President Trump started.

newsData.title: How Labor Unions Came to Define the L.A. Immigration Protests
newsData.summary: Unions have backed immigrant rights in California and have been on the forefront of resisting the Trump administration’s deportations.

newsData.title: U.S. Court Agrees to Keep Trump Tariffs Intact as Appeal Gets Underway
newsData.summary: The appeals court’s decision delivered an important but interim victory for the Trump administration.

newsData.title: Trump Hails Progress With China, but Details Are Sketchy
newsData.summary: Two days of trade talks resulted in what leaders called a framework agreement meant to solidify terms of a truce that the superpowers reached in Geneva last month.

newsData.title: European Union Unveils Fresh Sanctions on Russia, Including a Nord Stream Ban
newsData.summary: Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, announced a proposal meant to ramp up pressure on Moscow.

newsData.title: Clock Ticks as U.S. and China Try to Undo Devastating Trade Curbs
newsData.summary: Officials from the world’s largest economies will try to strike a deal Tuesday to relax painful export restrictions that they have imposed on each other.
